isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TURBOCHARGERS - REMOVAL AND REASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION

note.para: Steps 1 and 2 are required only when reinstalling a turbocharger which passed ALL the pre-disassembly inspections. See "RECONDITIONING" for detailed disassembly and reassembly procedures.

step1.para: Assemble the turbine housing to the center housing as follows:

note.para: CARE MUST BE TAKEN DURING THE HANDLING OF THE IMPELLER AND TURBINE WHEEL. BE VERY CAREFUL AND AVOID, BENDING ANY BLADES. BENT BLADES MUST NEVER BE USED.

step2.para:
Align the locating marks ( Figure 2.20
).
Install housing clamps and bolts.
Tighten housing bolts to specified torque.

step1.para: Assemble the compressor housing to the center housing back plate as follows:

step2.para:
Align the locating marks ( Figure 2.21
).
Install housing clamps and bolts.
Tighten the housing bolts to the specified torque.

step1.para:
Install the turbocharger on a clean exhaust manifold flange as follows: ( Figure 2.22
)

step2.para: Install a new gasket on the exhaust manifold flange. (Use grease to keep the gasket in place.)

note.para: Apply "NEVER SEEZ" compound to the turbocharger mounting hardware. This will aid in future removal.

step2.para: Install the turbocharger over the two mounting studs and fasten using nuts and washers.
Install the two bolts with nuts and washers at the lower end of the turbo and exhaust manifold flange.
Tighten nuts to specified torque.

figure.caption: Figure 2.20 Assemble Turbine and Center Housings (Align Marks).
Figure 2.21 Assemble Compressor Housing and Center Housing Back Plate (Align Marks).

step1.para:
Install the turbo oil drain tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 2.23
)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the oil drain port on the turbocharger and from the oil drain elbow at the crankcase.
Insert the oil drain tube hose over the elbow at the crankcase and secure using the worm-drive hose clamps.
Using a new gasket, align the oil drain tube and turbocharger flange and secure with the two mounting bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 2.23 Turbo Oil Drain Tube Installation.

step1.para:
Install the turbocharger oil inlet tube as follows: (Refer to Figure 2.24
)

step2.para: Remove the protective caps from the oil inlet port at the turbocharger and the oil inlet elbow at the oil filter header.

Pour four or five ounces of clean engine oil into the oil inlet opening of the turbocharger. This will provide sufficient lubrication for the turbocharger bearings until engine oil pressure is obtained.
Install a new rubber seal ring at the oil inlet tube connector nut.
Position a new gasket on the turbocharger oil inlet flange.
Align the oil inlet tube and fasten the connector nut at the elbow on the oil filter header.
Fasten the oil inlet tube at the turbo oil inlet flange using the two mounting bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 2.24 Turbo Oil Inlet Tube Installation.

step1.para: Install the crossover pipe at the turbo air outlet and the intake manifold inlet. Refer to MANIFOLDS for assembly instructions.
Connect the air cleaner housing and piping to the turbocharger.
Connect the exhaust elbow, sleeve and piping to the turbocharger exhaust outlet.

step2.para: Start the engine and operate at low RPM for a few minutes before loading engine.
Operate the engine, observing the turbo-charger for any of the following:
Air leaks in the air cleaner-to-turbocharger or turbocharger-to-intake manifold ducting.
Investigate and correct any of these conditions immediately to avoid possible turbocharger or engine failure.
Retighten capscrews, hold-down nuts, air connections to and from the turbocharger after the initial warm-up.
